pr_title: Fix overwritting downloaded files with same name

timeline.bodyText: Please put that into an else path in the if of line 91. (Declaring the variables here is OK). I find it hard if the contents of the variables are overwritten: The default case is that there is an extension.
timeline.author: koppor
koppor

replies.bodyText: After thinking longer, please rewrite to a while loop. Not testing for the counter in the test of a for loop is uncommon. Thus, hard to read when maintaining the code.
replies.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: No need for that variable. Can be tesed in the while condition.
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: Please include that in the assertEquals directly.
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: Please introduce Path dummyFile1 variable. In both usages of dummyFileX, you are resulting the name using the same path.
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText:
Good to have a test. - Could you add two more:

One for a non existing file
One for just one file existing

I know, these are trivial. - Nevertheless, if someone touches your code, even the trivial ones are tested then (and there could something go wrong)
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.message:
fixes #6068

- fixed downloading file with same name
- updated changelog

fixes #6068

- fixed downloading file with same name
- updated changelog

timeline.author: tobiasdiez
tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: Is there a need to have the temporary directory as a variable as well as an argument? I would prefer if all tests use the same format (either variable or either paramater)
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: The description seems to be off as no absolute path is returned but only the file name, right?
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: Deleting the file shouldn't be necessary as the TempDir should take care of this.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez
